name: 'Duck and Cover' Quiz / Test | 'West Wing' - Season 7 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Vinick helped get the San Andreo nuclear plant running twenty-five years ago.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After Bruno told Vinick about the nuclear plant being in trouble, Vinick told him that he helped get it open twenty-five years ago.

questions.text: What was the name of Vinick's daughter?
questions.explanation:
Jamie.

	Bruno mentioned Vinick's daughter by name, but never mentioned the name of his grandchildren when he saw Vinick having a hard time getting through to San Diego where his daughter lived.

questions.text: Who became the point man for the nuclear plant disaster?
questions.explanation:
President Bartlet.

	When CJ asked if they should find one person to handle the nuclear plant crisis, the President told her he was going to do it.

questions.text: When asked by a teenager at a Rock The Vote meeting, what did Santos say his favorite Bob Dylan album was?
questions.explanation:
Blonde on Blonde.

	Josh told Donna that Jay Leno was going to have a field day with Santos' answer to the Bob Dylan question and Santos said there were no policy implications to his favorite Bob Dylan album being "Blonde on Blonde".

questions.text: When the President called the Governor of California, he used the governor's first name. What was it?
questions.explanation:
Gabe.

	The President and Santos referred to Governor Tillman as Gabe when they were talking to him over the phone.

questions.text: What was the population of San Andreo?
questions.explanation:
42,000.

	CJ told the President the population of San Andreo and the radiation could cover the entire city.

questions.text: According to Bruno, Josh has the political equivalent of what?
questions.explanation:
Tourette's syndrome.

	Bruno told Bob Mayer, Vinick's speech writer, that Josh wouldn't be able to ignore the fact that Vinick helped get the nuclear plant started and that he would could give that information to the press at any time.

questions.text: What was the name of the man Will had transferred because he gave the press information about the nuclear plant crisis?
questions.explanation:
Blieden.

	During a press conference, a reporter told Will that Blieden said the winds could change at any time during the nuclear plant crisis. Since Will told everyone that he was the only one that was to talk to the press, Will had Blieden transferred and told he was never working for the government again.

questions.text: Did Donna have to say anything to a reporter about Vinick's involvement with the opening of the nuclear plant in San Andreo?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Josh held onto the news as long as he could until he couldn't stand it anymore that a reporter didn't have it. Finally, he told Donna to find a reporter and leak the information. When Donna found a reporter, she learned that the story was already out. Donna declined to make a statement about the story.

questions.text: What was the name of the civilian engineer that died from radiation poisoning?
questions.explanation:
James Cook.

	CJ informed the President after they had arrived back in Washington that James Cook had died from radiation poisoning after going into a coma.  On January 22, the announcement was made that the seventh season of "The West Wing" would be the shows last. The cancellation was agreed upon before the death of John Spencer.
